title: 114_hr4302
content: The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating all functions of the Bank as outlined in the Act. Functions transferred to the Secretary will end once all obligations are satisfied. The Secretary must report this determination to Congress. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act, including the administration and dissolution of functions transferred to them, handling outstanding obligations of the Federal Government from terminated programs, and taking necessary actions to dissolve any remaining affairs of the Bank. They may delegate functions as needed and no positions or functions of the Bank are authorized after 60 days of abolishment. Conforming amendments and repeals are also addressed. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including sections from various Acts. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including various sections from Acts such as the Bank Export Services Act, Public Law 90-390, Trade and Development Enhancement Act of 1983, Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act of 1990, and Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1988 is amended by removing subsection (a) and making changes to sections in title 31 of the United States Code. Additionally, compensation provisions related to positions at level iii and iv are eliminated. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1988 is amended to remove specific items related to the Export-Import Bank of Washington and the Office of Inspector General. The changes will take effect on the abolishment date, and a report on further amendments will be submitted to Congress. The Secretary will submit a report to Congress with suggestions for amendments to Federal statutes as necessary due to the Act. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal laws, orders, rules, or documents to a department or office affected by this Act will now refer to the new department or office. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. "Function" includes duties, powers, and programs, while "office" encompasses various organizational entities.
